<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.26</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Arrays </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Insert an element to the back of the given array. This command modifies the original array. (see also: [[pushBackUnique]]) </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> array '''pushBack''' element</value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> array: [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> element: [[Anything]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]] - index of inserted element</value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_arr = [1,2,3];
_arr [[pushBack]] 4;
[[hint]] [[str]] _arr; //[1,2,3,4]</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_arr = [1,[2,4],3];
(_arr [[select]] 1) [[pushBack]] [5,6];
[[hint]] [[str]] _arr //[1,[2,4,[5,6]],3]</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[pushBackUnique]], [[select]], [[set]], [[resize]], [[reverse]], [[count]], [[find]], [[in]], [[forEach]], [[deleteAt]], [[deleteRange]], [[append]], [[sort]], [[arrayIntersect]], [[apply]], [[BIS_fnc_arrayPushStack]], [[BIS_fnc_arrayPush]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on Aug 1, 2014 - 21:15
<dt class="note">[[User:ffur2007slx2_5|ffur2007slx2_5]]<dd class="note">
(A3 1.26) It is recommended to use [[pushBack]] instead of [[BIS_fnc_arrayPush]].
<code>_array = [1,2,3];
_array [[pushBack]] 4; //same as [_array, 4] [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_arrayPush]];
</code>
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

<h3 style="display:none">Bottom Section</h3>


[[Category:Arma_3:_New_Scripting_Commands_List|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
[[Category:Scripting Commands Arma 3|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
[[Category:Scripting Commands|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 23, 2014 - 21:35 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Skaronator|Skaronator]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
It's highly recommended to use the new [[pushBack]] command, up to 43% faster than [[set]] and up to '''11843%''' faster [[a plus b]]!
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes -->
</comment>
<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on November 26, 2014 - 18:25 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:DreadedEntity|DreadedEntity]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
[[pushBack]] does not support [[nil]] while [[set]] and [[a plus b]] do. For example:
<code>_array = [];
[[for]] "_i" [[from]] 0 [[to]] 3 [[do]]
{
	_array [[pushBack]] [[nil]];
};
[[hint]] [[str]] _array; //[[hint]] is []</code>
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes -->
</comment>
<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 21, 2015 - 10:52 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Array "push" implementation using [[pushBack]], alternative to [[BIS_fnc_arrayPush]]
<code>KK_fnc_push <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> {
	_this [[select]] 0 [[pushBack]] (_this [[select]] 1);
	_this [[select]] 0
};

// Example
arr <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> [1,2,3];
[arr, 4] [[call]] KK_fnc_push; //both arr and return of function are now [1,2,3,4]</code>
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes -->
</comment>
<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on October 5, 2016 - 02:19 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:OOKexOo|OOKexOo]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Note that [[pushBack]] does not create a new object.<br>
Therefore, if you edit an object that was pushed back to an array, it also affects the object in the array.
e.g.<br>
<code>_first_squence = [1,2,3];
_second_squence = [5,4];

_first_squence [[pushBack]] _second_squence;
systemChat str _first_squence // prints [1,2,3,[5,4]]]

reverse _second_squence;
systemChat str _first_squence // prints [1,2,3,[4,5]]]
</code><br>
If you pushBack an array for instance, you can just copy it to generate a new object.
e.g.<br>
<code>_first_squence [[pushBack]] +_second_squence;
</code>
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
